map.legendDescription: Unemployment rate (% of total labour force)

title: Unemployment rate (% of total labour force)
subtitle: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment. There may be persons not currently in the labour market who want to work but do not actively "seek" work because they view job opportunities as limited, or because they have restricted labour mobility, or face discrimination, or structural, social or cultural barriers. The exclusion of people who want to work but are not seeking work (often called the "hidden unemployed" or "discouraged workers") is a criterion that will affect the unemployment count of both women and men.
